pull.title: fuzz: Terminate immediately if a fuzzing harness tries to perform a DNS lookup (belt and suspenders)
pull.body:
Terminate immediately if a fuzzing harness tries to perform a DNS lookup (belt and suspenders).

Obviously this _should_ never happen, but if it _does_ happen we want immediate termination instead of a DNS lookup :)

rename.from: fuzz: Terminate immediately if a fuzzing input ever causes a DNS lookup (belts and suspenders)
rename.to: fuzz: Terminate immediately if a fuzzing harness ever tries to perform a DNS lookup (belts and suspenders)

events.message: fuzz: Terminate immediately if a fuzzing harness ever tries to perform a DNS lookup (belts and suspenders)

events.body: @MarcoFalke Thanks for reviewing. All feedback has been addressed. Let me know if there is anything more I can do :)
This bite me for good in #21878 (now [fixed](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21878#issuecomment-871399099)). It works!
@vasild This safety measure helped avoid an unwanted external DNS lookup? If so that's great news: thanks for sharing! :)
@practicalswift, yes! Fuzzing `CConnman::OpenNetworkConnection()`, it called `CConnman::ConnectNode()` which called `Lookup()` with the default `fNameLookup` which is `true`.
